blackdoor.util

Class DBP

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackdoor.util.DBP

  • public class DBP
extends java.lang.Object
    DeBugPrint. A class that allows output to be categorized before being printed. Different categories of output can then be enabled, disabled or redirected at runtime. The default output for most categories is System.out
    Author:
    nfischer3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      static boolean LOG 
      static boolean LOG_ALL
      When true, all output is written to the log file in addition to it's usual output.
      static boolean VERBOSE
      When true, calls to any print* or print*ln method act as if their corresponding flag is true.
      static boolean WARNING

    • Field Detail

      • DEBUG

        public static boolean DEBUG

      • ERROR

        public static boolean ERROR

      • DEV

        public static boolean DEV

      • DEMO

        public static boolean DEMO

      • WARNING

        public static boolean WARNING

      • LOG

        public static boolean LOG

      • ERROR_AS_SYSTEM_ERROR

        public static boolean ERROR_AS_SYSTEM_ERROR
        When true, all calls to printerror and printerrorln are written to System.err rather than the default output.

      • LOG_ALL

        public static boolean LOG_ALL
        When true, all output is written to the log file in addition to it's usual output.

      • VERBOSE

        public static boolean VERBOSE
        When true, calls to any print* or print*ln method act as if their corresponding flag is true. In other words all calls will result data being written to output. The exception to this is log, which is unaffected.

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultOutput

        public static void setDefaultOutput(java.io.PrintStream out)
        Sets the default (all output except log and/or error when ERROR_AS_SYSTEM_ERROR) PrintStream for DBP to write out to. If this method is not called then output will go to System.out
        Parameters:
        out - the PrintStream to use for all output except log and/or error when ERROR_AS_SYSTEM_ERROR = true.

      • printlog

        public static void printlog(java.lang.Object e)
        Prints e to a log file. Use this method for any output to be saved to the log file (obviously).
        Parameters:
        e -

        public static void printdebugln(java.lang.Object e)

      • printerror

        public static void printerror(java.lang.Object e)
        Use this method to print any errors. Try to make error output easily readable such that printing errors could be enabled in production code.
        Parameters:
        e -

        public static void printdev(java.lang.Object e)

        Parameters:

        public static void printwarning(java.lang.Object e)
        Use this to print warnings. Same rules as printerror(); warning output should be ok to enable in production.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • getLogFileLocation

        public static java.lang.String getLogFileLocation()
        Returns:
        The location of the active log file.

      • setLogFileLocation

        public static void setLogFileLocation(java.lang.String logFile)
                               throws DBP.SingletonAlreadyInitializedException
        Sets the location of the log file. Also initializes the DBP singleton, therefore it cannot be called twice.
        Parameters:
        logFile - The location of the file where calls to printlog and printlogln are written.
        Throws:
        DBP.SingletonAlreadyInitializedException - Thrown if the singleton has already been initialized.
